sources.title: Kansas Pacific
sources.description: With the Civil War about to begin, Southern sympathizers attempt to sabotage the railroad construction efforts so Army Captain John Nelson (Sterling Hayden) is brought in to keep the project going. Captain Nelson must not only contend with the efforts of the saboteurs but also try to romance the railroad foreman's daughter, Barbara Bruce (Eve Miller).

sources.title: Kansas Pacific
sources.description: You can find more information regarding this film on its IMDb page .

sources.title: Kansas Pacific (1953) STERLING HAYDEN
sources.description:
Stars: Sterling Hayden, Eve Miller and Barton MacLane
Director: Ray Nazarro

With the Civil War about to begin, Southern saboteurs attack frontier railroad construction.

metadata.Plot: Just before the Civil War (but after the South has seceded), Southern saboteurs try to prevent railroad construction from crossing Kansas to the frontier; army captain Nelson is sent out to oppose them. As the tracks push westward, Nelson must contend with increasingly violent sabotage, while trying to romance the foreman's pretty daughter Barbara.
metadata.Actors: Sterling Hayden, Eve Miller, Barton MacLane
